\begin{document}

\section{Testings}

Suppose $X$ is a topological space that's compact but not sequentially compact.

Then there exists a sequence $(x_n)$ in $X$ that has no convergent subsequence.

\begin{proposition}
    $(x_n)$ contains no term infinitely many times.
    
    
\end{proposition}

\end{document}
